text.content:
Damage & Healing

Rules for taking and recovering from damage

Hit Points

  • Represent your ability to avoid or withstand injury
  • Current HP can't exceed HP maximum
  • Dropping to 0 HP makes you Unconscious and Dying
  • HP can be negative (used for massive damage)

Damage Types

13 types of damage with different sources:

Physical Damage

  • Bludgeoning: Blunt force (hammers, falling)
  • Piercing: Puncturing (arrows, fangs)
  • Slashing: Cutting (swords, claws)

Elemental Damage

  • Acid: Corrosive substances
  • Cold: Freezing effects
  • Fire: Flames and heat
  • Lightning: Electrical energy
  • Thunder: Concussive sound

Magical Damage

  • Force: Pure magical energy
  • Necrotic: Life-draining energy
  • Poison: Toxic substances
  • Psychic: Mental attacks
  • Radiant: Holy or searing light

Damage Resistance, Vulnerability, and Immunity

  • Resistance: Take half damage (round down)
  • Vulnerability: Take double damage
  • Immunity: Take no damage
  • Multiple resistances don't stack
  • Resistance and vulnerability cancel out

Critical Hits

  • Natural 20 on attack roll
  • Roll all damage dice twice, then add modifiers
  • Example: Critical with 1d8+3 → Roll 2d8+3

Healing

Regaining Hit Points

  • Healing can't raise HP above maximum
  • Creature at 0 HP regains consciousness when healed to 1+ HP
  • Temporary HP doesn't count as healing

Sources of Healing

  • Spells: Cure Wounds, Healing Word, etc.
  • Potions: Potion of Healing (2d4+2 HP)
  • Rest: Short Rest (spend Hit Dice), Long Rest (recover all HP)
  • Class Features: Paladin's Lay on Hands, Cleric's Channel Divinity

Hit Dice

  • Each class has a Hit Die type (d6, d8, d10, or d12)
  • During Short Rest: Spend Hit Dice to regain HP
  • Roll the die + Constitution modifier
  • Regain spent Hit Dice on Long Rest (half your maximum, minimum 1)

Temporary Hit Points

  • Buffer against damage that's lost first
  • Can exceed HP maximum
  • Don't stack (take the higher value)
  • Lost when you take a Long Rest
  • Can't be healed or regained

Dropping to 0 Hit Points

Instant Death

Massive damage can kill you instantly:

  • Damage reduces you to 0 HP
  • Remaining damage equals or exceeds your HP maximum
  • Example: Max HP 12, take 24 damage → Instant death

Death Saving Throws

When at 0 HP and not dead:

  • Roll 1d20 at start of your turn (no modifiers)
  • 10+: Success (need 3 to stabilize)
  • 9 or lower: Failure (3 failures = death)
  • Natural 20: Regain 1 HP
  • Natural 1: Counts as 2 failures

Stabilizing

A creature at 0 HP can be stabilized:

  • 3 successful death saves: Stabilize but remain Unconscious at 0 HP
  • DC 10 Medicine check: Action to stabilize a creature
  • Any healing: Regains consciousness
  • After 1d4 hours: Regain 1 HP naturally

Damage at 0 HP

  • Any damage: One failed death save
  • Critical hit: Two failed death saves
  • Massive damage: Instant death if remaining damage ≥ HP max

Nonlethal Damage

  • Declare melee attack as nonlethal before rolling
  • When reduced to 0 HP: Knocked Unconscious, not dying
  • Stabilizes automatically
  • Regains consciousness after 1d4 hours or when healed
